fields.description:
h3. Summary
in IOS jira mobile app,
Unable to search for portal customers in Jira mobile app
It just keeps on loading
Although customer has been added into the project and can be assigned from web.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Jira mobile app
# Find an issue
# navigate to reporter field
# search for a service desk customer

h3. Expected Results
Able to show up the list of customers

h3. Actual Results
Spinner keeps loading

*Application logs:*

h3. Notes
Works in android 

h3.Workaround
N/A
fields.summary: iOS - Unable to search for portal customers in Jira Mobile App

fields.description:
It is expected that when the caller supplies the "x-atlassian-force-account-id" HTTP request header that change logs for an issue will describe the user making the change by account ID.

Currently users are being returned by user key, even when this header is sent.
fields.summary: REST API /rest/api/2/issue?expand=changelog does not return account IDs

fields.description:
steps are following
 1. create a project (for example Next Gen Scrum project with name NS)
 2. go to Jira Settings -> System -> Events
 3. click "NS: Simplified Notification Scheme" in column Associated Notification Schemes
 4. click "add" for "Issue Created (System)" event
 5. for "Issue created" event select a single user
 6. click press "add" button

the Error 500 screen is displayed.

 For Next Gen projects it should not be possible to change the notification scheme.
fields.summary: it shouldn't be possible to change the notification scheme on next-gen projects

fields.description: As per the linked Ecosystem ticket, the /rest/api/3/user/permission/search API does not provide any way to search for users by account ID.
fields.summary: REST API /rest/api/3/user/permission/search does not accept account IDs

fields.description:
{panel:title=Answer|bgColor=#F8F8F8}
The *m* (not M) stands for minute.

Month based search is not supported.

Considering that *m* stands for minutes, I've tested the searches again, and the results are correct.
{panel}

h3. *Summary*

JQL search towards relative date is inconsistent.

Here are some tests:
{panel}
h3. Tests in my test instance
Created three issues:
* RP-959:
** Created: 21/Nov/2018
** Duedate: 21/Dec/2018
* RP-960:
** Created: 21/Nov/2018
** Duedate: 20/Dec/2018
* RP-961
** Created: 21/Nov/2018
** Duedate: 21/Nov/2018

Searches and results:
* 1 -> {code}project = "Right project" AND key >= RP-959 AND duedate < 1M{code} No results;
* 2 -> {code}project = "Right project" AND key >= RP-959 AND duedate < 30d{code} *RP-961* and *RP-960* returned;
* 3 -> {code}project = "Right project" AND key >= RP-959 AND duedate > 1M{code} *RP-960* and *RP-959*;
* 4 -> {code}project = "Right project" AND key >= RP-959 AND duedate > 30d{code} no results.
{panel}


h3. Environment

Jira Cloud

h3. Expected Results

In these cases:
* Search number *1* should have returned RP-960 and RP-961
* Search number *3* should not have returned any result.

h3. Actual Results

* Search number *1* returned no result;
* Search number *3* returned two results.

h3. Workaround

As a suggestion, it did seem that using *duedate > startofday(1M)* (or with *<*) is working properly.
fields.summary: JQL relative date search towards month (M) is inconsistent

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira incorrectly display the post-functions *Update Issue Field* for assignee if the user only exist in _JIRA Internal Directory_ in the database

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* There are no specific steps to reproduce this in Jira Cloud. This normally happens during the Server-Cloud migration where user exist in _JIRA Internal Directory_

h3. Expected Results
The post-function *Update Issue Field* for assignee will be displayed assignee
{quote}
The *Assignee* of the issue will be set to *xxxxx*
{quote}
 !postfunction4.JPG|thumbnail! 
h3. Actual Results
The post-function *Update Issue Field* for assignee will be displayed assignee
{quote}
Only users with *Create Issues* permission can execute this transition.
{quote}
 !postfunction1.JPG|thumbnail!  
h3. Workaround
* Update the assignee value to a different user that exists/visible in UI
fields.summary: Jira incorrectly display the post-functions Update Issue Field for assignee

fields.description:
Given that next gen projects are in their relative infancy (love them so far btw), would it be beneficial to have a simple link from any NG projects to this issue tracker?

Pros:
 * It'd stop this stuff: [https://twitter.com/paulgrimes_/status/1064704741706354690]
 * It'd allow for quicker bug gathering
 * It might mitigate folks scrapping its usage if they find it buggy with no feedback loop

Cons:
 * It might bring on a flurry of frivolous support requests
fields.summary: Link to this issue tracker on next-gen projects for ease of bug gathering

fields.description:
As a developer using Jira cloud REST API I would like to be able to request all users except 'system' (or 'addon' or 'connect app') ones. It's impossible for now. I want this filtering because for a small team (<= 10 members) count of system users can be greater than real users count; and system users are not to be shown in many controls like owner editor. 

The filtering could be added to the following rest requests in the same manner latter filters for inactive users

[/rest/api/3/user/picker|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/?utm_source=%2Fcloud%2Fjira%2Fplatform%2Frest%2F&utm_medium=302#api-api-3-user-picker-get]

[/rest/api/3/user/search|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/?utm_source=%2Fcloud%2Fjira%2Fplatform%2Frest%2F&utm_medium=302#api-api-3-user-search-get]
 
 

Related links:
 [https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/rest-api-2-user-search-and-system-users/5161]

[https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/would-you-search-for-jira-users-similarly-to-how-you-search-for-issues/4880]

[https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/rest-api-retrieve-jira-users-without-addons/8717]
fields.summary: Allow filtering out addon users from REST results

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

When trying to use the Code Block function in the Description field, when choosing any language, it will return the below error.

 !Description Field.png|thumbnail! 

No error is throw in the Splunk or in the browser console.
In the Comments, it doesn't reproduce.

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

1) Go to an issue
2) Click to add text to the description
3) Choose the option "<>" to add a code block
4) Select a language
5) The error from the above screenshot will show up.

h3. Expected Results

It should allow you and don't have any error when selecting the language - like in the comments.

h3. Actual Results

That error is thrown and you can't even save the Description that you texted.

h3. Workaround

Turn off the old issue view and add the code you want.
fields.summary: The Code Block in the Description Field on the New Issue View Doesn't Work

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
* Sometimes there's a need to have a way to quickly associate issues to other issues.  Some customers would prefer to directly update a field as opposed to going through the link issue process

h3. Suggested Solution
* Implement a custom field type that allows issue keys to be searched and added to the issue
* User experience would be similar to that of the "Epic" field in Jira Software.

h3. Why this is important
* More flexibility in the way customers can use Jira to track resources(issues)
 
h3. Workaround 
* Use the issue linking feature
* Labels or components can be used instead of using issues resource actors
fields.summary: Create an issue key search custom field type

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

If you click on the heading button and select one of the options, but do not type any text in it, the view will display the following message in the description field when viewing the issue:
 !Screen Shot 2018-11-20 at 10.22.38.png|thumbnail! 

See the recording:  [^Unsupported content.mp4] 

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce

*1.* When editing the description/comments field, click on the header button and select one of the options:
 !Screen Shot 2018-11-20 at 10.24.55.png|thumbnail! 
*2.*  Press *enter* in the keyboard to skip the line;
*3.* Save.

h3. Expected Results

Jira won't try to save that content since it is empty.

h3. Actual Results

Jira tries to save the content of that header, resulting in the Unsupported content error.

h3. Workaround

No workaround at the moment
fields.summary: Unsupported content message if the description has a header formatted paragraph without text
UI submit button color

fields.description:
Please give us the ability to completely disconnect stride from Jira, and remove the "Create Room" option from the issue screen

 

For some reason I upload an image so will have to leave it without one.
fields.summary: Ability to remove Stride|Create room from Jira Issue screen

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The customer is not able to make mathematical operation to update a custom field using a post-function when transitioning from status A to status B.
h3. Suggested Solution

The customer should be able to to make mathematical operation to update a custom field using a post-function when transitioning from status A to status B
h3. Why this is important

Use cases:
 # Some customers willing to keep a count of the number of times the issue was transitioned to a particular status
 # Some customer wants to fetch values from custom field A and B to do a simple mathematical operation and update custom field C with the result.
fields.summary: Ability to perform mathematical operations to update a custom field using a post-function

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When invoking a non REST API call such as:

https://<instance-name>.atlassian.net/secure/projectavatar?pid=<pid_id>&avatarId=<avatar-id>

with OAuth2 mechanism, a 403 - Forbidden is thrown, but works when OAuth1 is used.

It would be great if OAuth2 could work with these type of URLs as well.
h3. Background

Vendor raised an issue thru devhelp, they were trying to access the projectAvatar URL with OAuth2 since they've already used this mechanism to access previous REST API endpoints but received a 403.

Upon investigation and testing, a lot of forums:
 - [Adding OAuth access token in curl header leads to "failed to parse connect session auth token"|https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/adding-oauth-access-token-in-curl-header-leads-to-failed-to-parse-connect-session-auth-token/]
 - [How to deal with "Failed to parse Connect Session Auth Token"?|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Core-questions/How-to-deal-with-quot-Failed-to-parse-Connect-Session-Auth-Token/qaq-p/829057]

talks about this and it seems that these never worked with OAuth2, but with OAuth1
fields.summary: Allow OAuth2 with non REST API URL

fields.description:
The Component feature is pretty useless in Jira Cloud. 

I / we / the world want to use Component as a way of organize stories, tasks and bugs into piles - This is currently not possible out of the box. Instead, Project managers need to redefine the meaning of Epics and Stories in order to achieve this. 
have a look here : https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-9554

The left pane on the boards should have a pane called Components where you can select which components to show. 

Tasks, Stories and other stuff on the board NEEDS to show the components that it is tagged with.
fields.summary: Make 'Components' Great Again (in JIRA Cloud)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When viewing the issue through the New Jira issue detail view, it is not possible to add custom fields between the description and the comment  sections.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability for admins to add custom fields between the description and the comment sections.

h3. Why this is important
This should enhance greatly the user experience.

h3. Workaround 
There is none.
fields.summary: As an admin, I'd like to place custom fields between the description and the comment section in the New Jira issue detail view

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
If you need to include the issue key of an issue on a comment or another text field it will be turned into an issue link even if you don´t want it.
For instance, if you have a project called *Test Software Project* with a key *TST* and you have a version for your software called *TST-1.2.23* if you add this line to any text field it will render an issue key on the field.
 !Screen Shot 2018-11-16 at 15.27.11.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screen Shot 2018-11-16 at 15.27.30.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
A solution would be if Jira were able to distinguish between the issue key and regular text, for instance, if there are any other characters before or after the word that corresponds to an issue key Jira should ignore it and consider it as a regular text.

h3. Workaround
Use the \{noformat\} tag
 !Screen Shot 2018-11-16 at 15.28.04.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screen Shot 2018-11-16 at 15.28.12.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Allow Jira to distinguish between an issue key and regular text

fields.description:
h3. Summary

As a user, I would like to search for any issues that have a specific text, based on what I typed on the search box.

h3. Expected Results

Return any issues with that text.

h3. Actual Results

Return only issues with the text in Description or Summary.
fields.summary: The Quick Search should find issues with any text, not only in Description and Summary

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The "L" key shortcut for bento doesn't work in the New "full detail" Issue View.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Be sure you have the New "full detail" Issue view enabled;
# Access any issue (from a core project, in this example);
# Press the "L" to open the labels menu.

h3. Expected Results
* The labels menu is presented.

 !old.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
* Nothing happens.

 !new.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround(s)
* Click "show more" until you see the labels field. Then, you can click on it to edit the labels.
fields.summary: The "L" shortcut for labels doesn't work in the New Issue View

fields.description:
JIRA comes with a *Team* custom field built in that is for Portfolio. Since the field is locked, for users with multiple fields under this same name, it gets confusing filter wise.

 !Custom_fields_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggestion

Add a clear description to the custom field so that it is at least clear in the Basic search what field is being used.

 !Issue_navigator_-_JIRA.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Add a description to the Portfolio "Team" custom field

fields.description:
Confluence supports the 'diff' code block. Why doesn't Jira mirror the same language formatting options?

 

It would be awesome if the same-named macros in all systems mirrored each other in functionality.

 

This was requested for Jira server way back in 2010, and declined: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-20751
fields.summary: Support 'diff' code block language

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When trying to set a filter, the option to search for the owner of the filter is not working, instead of returning only the filters that are owned by the user that is being searched all the available filters are returned.
h3. Environment

Jira Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add the *Two Dimensional Filter Statistics* gadget to a Dashboard
 # On the configuration of the gadget select *Advanced Search*
 !advancedsearch.png|thumbnail!
 # On the tab *Search* add a user to the field *Owner* (The user must own shared filters), click Search
 !search.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

The search should return only the filters owned by the user that was set on the *Owner* field.
h3. Actual Results

All the available filers will be returned as the result of the search.
 !result.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes

This behavior is observed only on the gadget, on the filters search page of Jira the *Owner* option does correctly returned the expected results.
h3. Workaround

Search by the name of the filter
fields.summary: Using Advanced Search in a gadget to search filter by owner returns all filters

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

If you perform a search using special character in the quick search, it will return no results.

Affected characters:
 * /
 * _
 * -
 * &

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Have an issue with a description that contains one of the affected characters: e.g. test-test
 2. Start searching for it. Notice that the results include that issue:
 !Screen Shot 2018-11-15 at 15.03.03.png|thumbnail! 
 3. Try searching for the rest of the string:
 !Screen Shot 2018-11-15 at 15.03.29.png|thumbnail!
h3. Expected Results

The result should keep displaying at least the issue that has the exact string.
h3. Actual Results

The search won't return any result.
h3. Workaround

search for the first part of the string (before the special character).
fields.summary: Quick search won't return results if you type special characters in the search

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At this moment, with the new, updated left sidebar, if it is collapsed and the user hovers the mouse over it, it automatically expands.

To verify if your Cloud instance has this updated left sidebar:
 !updated navigation left sidebar.png|thumbnail! 

Behaviour with the new, updated left sidebar:
 !updated left sidebar.png|thumbnail! 

Behaviour with the previous left sidebar:
 !previous left sidebar.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability for users to choose the behaviour of the left sidebar, either enabling or disabling the full menu when the sidebar is collapsed and the user hovers the mouse over it.

h3. Why this is important
Users were already used with a minimalistic, collapsed left sidebar. Re-adding this feature would greatly improve the user experience.

h3. Workaround 
There are many functionalities of the left sidebar that can be accessed via *keyboard shortcuts*. To consult the full list, type the *question mark* (*?*) in your keyboard.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like the new left sidebar to stay collapsed even if I hover the mouse over it

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

Under _Start the migration process_ section (step 5) to perform Bulk Changes, it doesn't mention what permission required to perform this action. Some users can't perform this and they don't know why.
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/migrate-between-next-gen-and-classic-projects-957974933.html

 
h3. Suggested Resolution

Please add a section/information to inform users that they need *Make bulk changes* permission from Global permission to do this.
fields.summary: Update "Migrate between next-gen and classic projects" docs

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

If you format a text (e.g. bold, code)  in a bullet list line, numeric list line or alphabetical list line, and then add a sub-bullet list in the next line, Jira breaks the line for that text.

Here are two examples:
||Before saving||After saving||
| !Screen Shot 2018-11-15 at 09.39.05.png|thumbnail! | !Screen Shot 2018-11-15 at 09.39.17.png|thumbnail! |
| !Screen Shot 2018-11-15 at 09.40.36.png|thumbnail! | !Screen Shot 2018-11-15 at 09.40.46.png|thumbnail! |

This affects the *Description*, and the *Comment* field.

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Type *, then press space to start a bullet list;
# Type some text in that same line;
# Format part of it as *bold* (or even italic, code) -> press enter so it will go to a new line;
# Press *tab* to turn the new line into a sub-bullet list -> type some text in that line;
# *Save*.

h3. Expected Results

The content will be saved as it was being displayed during edition (without breaking the lines).

h3. Actual Results

Jira breaks the line before and after the formatted text.

h3. Workaround

It does not happen in the old issue view.

In order to deactivate the new issue view:
* Profile icon -> *Personal settings* (or Profile if there is no such option);
* Turn off the *Labs* feature.
fields.summary: Line will break before and after formatted text in a bullet list's line if there is a sub-bullet list in the next line

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Managing permisions with respect to user roles and user groups should be simplified.
Creating and managing permissions are complicated.

h3. Why this is important
This is important for the customers to create efficient permission scheme for each project
fields.summary: Simplify Jira Permission Scheme

fields.description:
Currently the time logged on tickets is visible to all users who have browse permissions on an issue. 

It would be great if individual users can only see the time they have logged on a ticket.
fields.summary: Restrict Time logged in Jira tickets to individual users

fields.description: Export more than 1,000 issues at one time
fields.summary: Export more than 1,000 issues at one time

fields.description:
*Description:* 
Currently, it's not possible to change the order of the filters and columns in the projects' page.
Also, not all columns are useful for all customers and we can't hide those that we don't use.

*Suggestion:*
Add the ability for admins to edit the projects' page, so they can let only necessary information for their agents.
fields.summary: Ability to customize "Browse project" page

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

When clicking on assignee's scrollbar in the issue detail view, the assignee window will close as if you've clicked outside of it's range.

See the recording:  [^Assignee scrollbar - issue detail view.mp4] 

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Have at least 5 users (plus yours) as an assignable user in the project so the scrollbar will be displayed;
# Go to a board;
# Click on a card;
# Click on the assignee field;
# Click on it's scrollbar.

h3. Expected Results

You will be able to drag the scrollbar so you can see the other users.

h3. Actual Results

The assignee's window closes.

h3. Workaround

Using the mouse's scroll wheel and the keyboard's arrow buttons works as expected.
fields.summary: Clicking on the assignee scrollbar in the new issue detail view will close the assignee window

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Intermittent 403 error returned via API retrieving worklogs - /rest/api/3/issue/

{issueIdOrKey}/worklog
 
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Using OAuth 2.0 3LO authentication
# Retrieve around 250 worklogs from a list of issues
# Notice a failure rate of around 1/30
 
h3. Expected Results
 
All worklogs are fetched without error
 
h3. Actual Results
403 Intermittently returned
 
h3. Notes
 
Right now, I'm trying to get all worklogs for a list of previously fetched issues. For that, I'm using `GET /rest/api/3/issue/\{issueIdOrKey}

/worklog`. From what I can see in the API documentation, it requires `read:jira-work`.

The thing that I noticed is that the more worklogs I'm trying to fetch at one time, the more likely it is that the error will occur. For example, I have no errors with 30 worklogs, but with 250 the success/error ratio is about 1/30.

In the error I also got the information which specific url(

{issueId}

/worklog) caused the problem. I was trying to get only that one worklog in a separate call and it was just OK.

For me it looks like I'm trying to do too many requests at one time, but then, shouldn't the error be different than Forbidden 403?
h3. Workaround

No known workaround
fields.summary: Intermittent 403 error returned via API retrieving worklogs - /rest/api/3/issue/{issueIdOrKey}/worklog

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
There is no option to give a satisfaction rating in Jira
h3. Suggested Solution
Add the option to have a satisfaction rating (e.g. 0-5 stars)  for Jira issues
h3. Why this is important
Admins would like to option to provide a rating for developers/users when a task is completed
fields.summary: Satisfaction Survey for Jira

fields.description:
h3. Problem statement

On the user profile, the user was able to see which groups they are a member of. After the introduction of the new "People" page and "Peronal settings", the profile page is no longer the same as before and the user is not able to see this group membership information any longer. 


h3. Suggestion

Have an option which admins can turn off and on as needed for users in the instance to see their group membership. Or just add the group membership information the profile/people page of the user.
fields.summary: Bring back the "group memberships" of a user in the User Profile page

fields.description: In some Jira instances I have worked with there has been a field 'Problem in production' for defects and bugs. This is very useful I think but I cannot find it in the current Jira instance that I'm working with. Is this something that you would consider to have as a standard field?
fields.summary: Problem in production

fields.description:
I would like to propose implementing /batch endpoint similar to this in Trello https://developers.trello.com/reference/.

This would help us reduce number of calls to REST API.
fields.summary: Batch read endpoint

fields.description:
Jira Cloud Apps can update the status of their issue glance as per:

https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/modules/issue-glance/

However, users viewing the issue will need to refresh the page before they see the updated values. 

The suggestion here is to have these panels automatically update, either in real-time or at a regular interval, so that the user is kept up to date with changes to the glance status.
fields.summary: Jira Cloud's new issue view should update the glance automatically when the glance status is modified.
Updating an issue via REST to set a user field to a null value returns incorrect error message

fields.description:
Currently, the Team field has a limited context that can only be used through the advanced search at the Issue Navigator, however, by changing to the basic search, the team field is disabled.

Please, make the Team field useable through basic searches on Issue Navigator
fields.summary: Ability to use Team field through Basic Search

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When attempting to run a Jira site import, if the backup that you're trying to import is a large file, while processing the file, the task fails with the following error:
{quote}
An error occurred when importing the file jira-backup.zip: Validation was cancelled or an unexpected error occurred Try again or select a different file.
{quote}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Generate a backup of a large Jira instance
# Try to import this backup in a Jira Cloud instance.

h3. Expected Results
The import will be able to process the file and proceed with the import task.

h3. Actual Results
The import fails while processing the file and doesn't go further.
 
h3. Workaround
Keep trying as after some attempts, the import goes through.
fields.summary: Site import fails while processing the file if it's a big file

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Hiding Priority or Resolution,  field causes the error message *"The JIRA server could not be contacted. This may be a temporary glitch or the server may be down."* to appear when viewing a Project > Issues. 

h3. Environment
{{JIRA v7.0.0-OD-02-247}}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Field Configurations
# Hide Priority Field
# Go to a project using the field configuration
# See error message and no issues displayed

h3. Expected Results
Issues should still display

h3. Actual Results
No error is shown in the JIRA log.

Error message that appears
{noformat}
The JIRA server could not be contacted. This may be a temporary glitch or the server may be down.
{noformat}

What console displays:
{noformat}
/rest/issueNav/1/issueTable Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 400 (Bad Request)
batch.js:216 DEPRECATED - Persistent: false has been deprecated and will be removed in a future release. 
     at showMsg (https://d1ixbz5qgnvms3.cloudfront.net/instance.atlassian.net/s/c5c95a3c91…_super/batch.js?atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&locale=en-US:2531:1465)
{noformat}
 
h3.Workaround
Go to Field Configuration and change Priority or Resolution to *Show*
or
Change the "Order by" option to a visible field
fields.summary: Hiding Priority or Resolution Field Causes Issues To Not Be Displayed When Viewing A Project Board

fields.description:
h3. Summary

It is possible, by doing some steps, to delete *all the issue types from the Default issue type scheme* when this happens, different issue type scheme associations break causing multiple problems.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the Issue Type Scheme page
 # Delete all issue types in the Default Issue Type Scheme until there are only 2 left.
 # Open a new tab and go to the Default Issue Type Scheme
 # Delete one issue type remaining in the scheme in each tab.

h3. Expected Results
 * One of the delete actions will be failed because we don't allow the last issue type to be deleted from the scheme.

h3. Actual Results
 * Two delete actions are successful, causing the issue types to be deleted resulting in 500 errors within multiple actions, i.e: Issue Creation, opening issue type scheme pages

h3. Workaround

Contact Atlassian Support
fields.summary: Certain actions can delete all the issue types from the default issue type scheme and break schemes associations

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The render action on Fields Configuration doesn't point to the right field if you have a *custom field from a next-gen project*.

Currently, the render action page URL has a number on the end of it. This number is the sequential number of custom fields in Jira. This number is used to point which custom field will be accessed. For example:
||Custom Field||Seq. Number||render URL||field pointed by the URL||
|Custom Field A|0|rendererEdit=0|A|
|Custom Field B|1|rendererEdit=1|B|
|Custom Field C|2|rendererEdit=2|C|
|Custom Field D|3|rendererEdit=3|D|

If you have a *Next-Gen* project and you create a new custom field, this custom field will not be displayed on the Fields Configuration page. But, this field will be added on the list, without affecting the sequential number. For example:
||Custom Field||Seq. Number||render URL||field pointed by the URL||
|Custom Field A|0|rendererEdit=0|A|
|(NEXT-GEN)Custom Field AB|-|-|-|
|Custom Field B|1|rendererEdit=1|AB|
|Custom Field C|2|rendererEdit=2|B|
|Custom Field D|3|rendererEdit=3|C|
|(NEXT-GEN)Custom Field DE|-|-|-|
|Custom Field E|4|rendererEdit=4|D|

*The next-gen custom field doesn't appear on the Fields Configuration page.
h3. Environment
Jira Cloud.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a next-gen project
# On this next-gen project, create a new custom field and click on *Save*
# Go to the Fields Configuration page

h3. Expected Results
When clicking on *renderers* of a custom field positioned *after*(in alphabetical order) the next-gen custom field, the renderer page should be the correct one. 

h3. Actual Results
The list of renderers custom field pages are *shifted* and it'll open a different custom field page. 

h3. Workaround
Change manually the number on the end of the URL to point to the correct custom field.
fields.summary: Render action on Fields Configuration redirects to a wrong custom field if Jira has Next-Gen custom field

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Group's membership count consider add-on users, however, when opening the group, the add-on users don't show up in the UI as a member of the group.

h3. Suggested Solution

# Show the add-on users inside the group in the UI.

h3. Why this is important
The inconsistency in the group members can lead to miss-understanding about the real membership count of the groups.
 
h3. Workaround 
N/A
fields.summary: Display add-on users as well when viewing the users inside a group

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

When there is a issue key in the description, or in the comment (which generates a link), if you hover the cursor over it, a pop-up with its summary.

When following the link, the pop-up won't disappear.

See the recordings:  [^Issue link - Description's default text renderer.mp4],  [^Issue link - Comment's default text renderer.mp4] 

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In the field configuration, set the render to *default text render* for the *Description*, and to the *Comment* field;
# Type an existing issue key in both fields;
# Hover the cursor over the issue key, and wait a second or two so the pop-up will be displayed;
# Click on the link to open the issue in the full view.

h3. Expected Results

The pop-up will disappear once the issue's view is loaded.

h3. Actual Results

The pop-up keeps being displayed until the page is reloaded, or until you go to a different section.

h3. Workaround

No workaround at the moment
fields.summary: Issue link's pop-up won't disappear upon following the link when using the default text renderer

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Scrollbar not available in the attach screenshot Modal dialog in Jira thus unable to view the upload button.

h3. Suggested Solution
Either the scrollbar should be integrated with the attach screenshot Modal dialog or the Modal should resize according to the screen.

h3. Why this is important
Customers are unable to upload screenshots/ attachment as the 'upload' button is hidden in the Modal Dialog when Jira is accessed on machines with smaller screens.

h3. Steps to Reproduce the issue 
* Press CTRL + CMD + Shift + 3
* Open an Issue where the screenshot is to be attached.
* CMD + V

Unable to view the upload button.

h3. Notes

This mainly occurs on the *Create Issue* Screen.

 !ezgif.com-optimize (1).gif|width=400&height=200!

h3. Workarounds

Zoom out 80% (may vary depending on your window size) to view the *Insert file* button to upload the attachment.
fields.summary: Scrollbar not available in the attach screenshot Modal dialog in Jira

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The "Bulk Operation" button shown in the 'sub-tasks' session from a parent issue is shown for *users who don't have the permission*, and it throws a 404 page when trying to perform the bulk


h3. Environment
* Tested within Jira Cloud


h3. Steps to Reproduce:


# Remove the "make bulk changes" permission from your user
# On an issue with sub-tasks, try to perform any "bulk operation" within the sub-tasks panel (steps outlined in the video)

h3. Expected Results

* The "bulk operation" button isn't shown if the user has no permissions to do it

h3. Actual Results
The button is displayed and a 404 is thrown when trying to perform the operation

h3. Notes
To see this happening check this video -> https://screencast-o-matic.com/watch/cFXlqBrVHe

h3.Workaround
None at the moment, if this is happening to someone that should be able to do it, make sure to provide the global permission "make bulk changes"
fields.summary: Sub-tasks "bulk operation" doesn't check for permission and throws 404 error (when unpermitted)

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using Google Chrome's native language translation feature, the "Find new apps" page does not load properly:
{noformat}
https://<instance_name>.atlassian.net/plugins/servlet/upm/marketplace/featured?source=side_nav_find_new_addons
{noformat}

h3. Environment
* Chrome Version 70.0.3538.102 (Official Build) (64-bit)
* Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Chrome, navigate to Settings > Advanced; scroll down to "Languages"
# Set Chrome to "Offer to translate pages in this language" 
!Screen Shot 2018-11-12 at 18.47.14.png|thumbnail!
# In Jira, navigate to the Find new apps or Manage apps page: Jira Settings > Apps > "Find new apps"
 

h3. Expected Results
 !Screen Shot 2018-11-12 at 18.48.33.png|thumbnail! 
(Chrome translating to Vietnamese)

h3. Actual Results
 !Screen Shot 2018-11-12 at 18.44.34.png|thumbnail! 
(Chrome translating to Hungarian)

h3. Notes
* Tested in Chrome Version 70.0.3538.102 (Official Build) (64-bit)
* Could only replicate the issue when Chrome is translating to Hungarian
* Tried testing in Vietnamese, Hebrew, Greek - couldn't replicate the issue
* Apps can't be installed at all, users are redirected from [marketplace.atlassian.com|https://marketplace.atlassian.com] to the instance - where the page doesn't fully load

h3.Workaround
* If the language pack exists in Jira, change Jira's language in your [personal settings|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/manage-your-jira-personal-settings-952598541.html]
* Temporarily turn off the translation settings in Google Chrome
fields.summary: "Find new apps" page not properly loading when using Google Chrome's translation feature

fields.description:
A vendor has approached me and showed that he cannot save a description. Jira replied with a 400, and it was caused by the editor sending an invalid payload.   The payload that was sent was:  

Changes needed in Jira dwh schema tables jira_assignees, jira_reporters, jira_logged_by, jira_transition_authors

  • name: accountId
  • display_name: cached display name. If duplicate then add (id) at the end
  • groups: Jira user groups, are they considered personal data?
  • email: better do not store anymore
  • user_key: store for some while to ensure that users are correctly migrated, will be needed also for Tempo APIs until they are accountId compatible
  • external_id: maybe store here accountId as well to identify which records are migrated to accountId (maybe not needed if updated_at will be stored only for accountId records)
  • updated_at: maybe store when the data were updated that can be used for reporting stored personal data

Atlassian documentation links:

  • [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/api-changes-for-user-privacy-announcement/]
  • [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/api-changes-for-user-privacy-announcement-connect/]
  • [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/user-privacy-developer-guide/]
  • [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/deprecation-notice-user-privacy-api-migration-guide/]
fields.summary: Cannot save description - Error message cannot convert Html to WikiMarkup

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Landing page unable to identify the user without Jira Application Access

Steps to reproduce the issue:
In order to not to have the site-admins being billed as a user in the Jira Cloud subscription, the user removed the Jira Application access for the site admins. The users are now not able to log in using the home page. 
1. Remove the Jira Application access for the site-admin group.
2. Login as the site-admin and the landing page will not be able to identify the user since Jira application access has not been granted.

Workaround:
The site-admins who have not been granted the Jira/Confluence access will need to access the instance using the link:
https://<instanceName>.atlassian.net/admin/users
h3. Suggested Solution

The landing page should be able to recognise the user’s access and display the various segments of the instance to him accordingly.
h3. Why this is important

Any user who has only Confluence access, and not Jira access; or a user who is a site-admin and does not have product access and is just a site-admin will not be recognised as a logged in user on the landing page. They need to access the instance using a direct link to the application/segment they are trying to access, navigation from the landing page is not possible.
fields.summary: Landing page unable to identify the user without Jira Application Access

fields.description:
h3. Summary

According to [this|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/?utm_source=%2Fcloud%2Fjira%2Fplatform%2Frest%2F&utm_medium=302#api-api-3-issue-issueIdOrKey-delete] documentation, in order to make an issue *unassigned* the *name* parameter in the request must be set to null.

Since we're deprecating this parameter and replacing it for *accountId*, it should work exactly the same as it did with *name*. However, when setting the accountId to *null*, the REST api call returns *Bad request*

h3. *Steps to replicate*
# Create an issue and make sure that it's assigned to a user
# cUrl request:
{code}
curl -X PUT \
  https://<instance_name>.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/issue/<issue_key> \
  -H 'Authorization: Basic <basic>' \
  -H 'Cache-Control: no-cache' \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -d '{ "accountId": null }'
{code}

h3. Expected behavior:
* Should be able to update issue's assignee to *unassigned*.

h3. Actual behavior:
* *Bad request* is returned:
{code}
{"errorMessages":[],"errors":{"assignee":"expected Object containing a 'name' property"}}
{code}

h3. Additional details:
 * Problem can be reproduced with both *accountId* and *id*
fields.summary: API Endpoint "/rest/api/3/issue/{issueIdOrKey}" returns 400 if accountId is null

h3. Summary
Notifications are displayed in the notification panel for issues that should not be shown and are not accessible by the user seeing the notification.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create 2 service desk projects A & B.
 # Create a user group which has Jira Software product access.
 # Ensure the project permissions for B do not allow any access to software users or global access or to the newly created user group.
 # Ensure project A can only be accessed by service desk users, admins and people in the user group we created.
 # Update issues in project B.
 # Impersonate user who only has access to project A via being a member of the newly created user group.
 # Check notifications panel.

h3. Expected Results
The user should only see notifications for issues in project A.

h3. Actual Results
The user is able to see notifications for project B as well as A.

h3. Notes
The users in question are given access to Jira Service Desk project as Jira Software users/collaborators yet have no access to any Jira Software projects.

h3. Workaround
None

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently as covered in the [Roadmap | https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/roadmap-955164013.html] feature documentation, the dates are manually adjusted or If no end date is set, the epic will automatically end one month from the day it was created.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be beneficial to calculate an end date based on a sum of the estimates of the issue and child issues rather than manual definition
fields.summary: Calculate Due Dates of epics in Roadmap

fields.description:
While very useful, the information displayed under *Worked On* > *View all* only shows issues that the user created, assigned, commented etc.

It would be great to have the ability to edit the feed, including any other information.
fields.summary: Customize the "Worked on" profile feed

fields.description:
I’d like to be able to opt into notifications for items when they are in specific states, as well as being able to create more rules for projects so that I can have better control over notifications of issues of a certain type.

To give use cases for what I had in mind:
I oversee QA at my company, and I would like to opt into issue comments/updates when they are in our “ready to test” state rather than all comments on issues across the board.

The use case for my other request builds off of the above:
Being the QA team, we care more about the lifecycle of a Bug over something like a Story. For bugs maybe we’d like to see the comments made on it throughout it’s entire lifecycle regardless of state, but on the same project also avoid comments on a Story while it’s in progress, but get those comments when it’s “ready to test” (as above).
fields.summary: More granular control over notifications

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The Remaining estimate is not updated when the Original estimate is filled on the issue

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud with the new issue view

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enable the new issue view on the *Profile Settings*
# Add *Time Tracking* to the issue's edit screen
# Create a new issue
# Open the issue and enter a value on *Time estimate*

h3. Expected Results
*Remaining estimate* receives the same value as *Time estimate*

h3. Actual Results
*Remaining estimate* is not updated
 
h3. Workaround
This specifically happens on the new issue view only. You can either permanently disable the new issue view on your *Personal Settings* or temporarily with the *See the old view* button
fields.summary: Remaining estimate is not updated when original estimate is filled on the issue

fields.description:
h3. Summary

As an admin, I would like to isolate a permission for users to change the ownership of filters, without needing to add the users to an administration position.

h3. Expected Results

Have the permission to allow users to change ownership of filters.

h3. Actual Results

There is no permission, only with the user is an administrator.
fields.summary: Have the Permission to Change Ownership of Filters

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The webhook in JIRA does not contain any information about the attachment if the issue was created using email. However, it does contain the attachment information if the issue was created using UI.

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to reproduce.
 * Set up a webhook in JIRA for 'Issue Created' event.
 * Now create an issue using the JIRA UI in a way that the webhook event will be triggered.
 * Notice that in the JSON, there is attachment information present.
 * Now create another issue with the same attachment but using through email
 * Notice that in the JSON, there is no attachment information present
 * The issue created has the attachment present.

(See attachments)

On a side note : 
 If issue is moved from one issuetype to another issue type that is sending information via webhook then also the attachment are not sent. But if those attachments are added after movement then they are sent via webhook.


h3. Expected Results

The webhook's response should display the value for the attachment field.

h3. Actual Results

An empty array is returned in the attachment's key.

h3. Workaround

No workaround at the moment
fields.summary: Jira webhook doesn't send information about attachments when issue is created via email

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

Webhook's response returns an empty array for attachments in the issue created event when issue is created via issue collector even though the issue contains an attachment:
 !Screen Shot 2018-11-07 at 13.08.37.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce

*1.* Create an issue collector, checking the *Attach file* option so users can attach file to the form;
*2.* Create a webhook (issue created event) that will return issues from the project related to the issue collector.
*3.* Create an issue from the issue collector form:
* In my test, I've just opened a file with HTML and the embedded script in Chrome;
* This is the file template:  [^test.html] 
* Check the result from the webhook (the attachment key).

h3. Expected Results

The issue created event should have a value for the attachment key in the response.

h3. Actual Results

The response returns an empty array for the Attachment key.

h3. Workaround

No workaround at the moment
fields.summary: Webhook's issue created event response from issue created via Issue collector returns an empty array for the attachment key

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

At the moment, there is no option to create a dynamic field in Jira (a field based on another field)
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide the option to create a dynamic field
h3. Workaround

Add-On vendors provide this behavior, for example [ProForma: Forms & Custom Fields for Jira|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1215833/proforma-forms-custom-fields-for-jira?hosting=cloud&tab=overview]
fields.summary: Use of dynamic fields in Jira

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

When changing the context of a field, all issues associated with that will have the field updated (e.g. removing a project from a field context will set the values for that field to none).

But when such modification occurs, and a user is editing an issue (or simply click on Edit without reloading the page for that issue), the history will create an entry as if the user had set the value of the custom field (whose context has been modified) to none.

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce

*1.* Create a field context in a custom field, pointing to a specific project:
 !Screen Shot 2018-11-07 at 10.33.56.png|thumbnail! 
*2.* Set a value for that same custom field in an issue from the referred project. Leave it's view page open;
*3.* In a new tab, edit the custom field's context, removing that project from it:
 !Screen Shot 2018-11-07 at 10.49.47.png|thumbnail! 
*4.* Go back to the issue view page of the previous issue, but do not reload the page. Click on Edit, and edit the value of another field. Update, and then check the history entry:
 !Screen Shot 2018-11-07 at 10.40.32.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

The entry should not include an update made to the custom field whose context was modified, as it can be misleading.

h3. Actual Results

Jira creates an entry as if the user had edited the custom field's value.

h3. Workaround

No workaround at the moment
fields.summary: Concurrent issue edition with custom field's context change

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In Jira new issue view, users who edited an issue's description can leave the change by navigating to other pages and the change won't be saved. In the previous issue view, all changes will be automatically saved once the focus is moved.

The difference in behaviour leave users with the impression that the change is saved causing misinformation to other users until the author visit the issue again and click on *Save*.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Go to any issue in new issue view.
# Edit Description or add a new Comment.
# Without clicking on *Save*, navigate to another part of Jira e.g. other issues, administrations pages, etc.
# Revisit the issue and you can still see the change made in _Edit_ mode.

h3. Expected result
The behaviour where changes are saved automatically as per in previous issue view to maintaining consistency.

h3. Current result
Changes made are not saved until the author realize it.
fields.summary: New issue view doesn't automatically save changes to Description and/or create comment

fields.description:
Currently, subtasks do not inherit labels field from the parent task. It would be handy to have this functionality built-in to the Jira application.

At the moment, the workaround is to use the [JIRA Misc Workflow Extensions plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/292/jira-misc-workflow-extensions?hosting=cloud&tab=overview]. There is an option called "Set field value from parent".
fields.summary: Subtasks should inherit labels from the parent task

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Burn Up reports show future dates in Next Gen projects. 

h3. Steps to replicate

# Create a next gen project
# Start a sprint 
# mark an issue as done
# Check the Burn Up Reports

h3. Expected Results
The date time stamps in the Burn Up report match with the actual date time on the issue. 

h3. Actual Results
The date time stamps in the Burn Up report does not match with the actual date time on the issue. They are in the future and ahead by about 10hours.
fields.summary: Incorrect Dates in Burn Up reports in Next Gen projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Not able to @ mention reporter if the reporter is a 'portal only customer' on JSD tickets.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a JSD ticket using email or portal as a portal only customer.
# Ask agent to @ mention user in a comment on the ticket using  '@username', '@reporter' or '@name' options.

h3. Expected result
Agent should be able to tag the reporter in the comment.

h3. Actual result
Agent not able to tag the reporter if the reporter is a portal only customer.

h3. Additional Notes
* This behavior is observed in both iOS and Android apps. 

h3. Workaround
No known workaround except that Agent can tag the customer when accessed the ticket in a browser.
fields.summary: Not able to @ mention reporter (customer) in Mobile app on JSD tickets

fields.description:
With Jira's improvements to user privacy, it is expected that the JQL autocomplete data will return the correct accountId values for the users it suggests. Currently it does not do that.

It returns a "value" attribute which is always the user name. There is no way to get the accountId.
fields.summary: REST endpoint to suggest users for JQL does not return account IDs

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

I've identified inconsistencies in the results displayed by the Created vs. Resolved Gadget:
{panel}
*1.* The gadget is not handling correctly the values from the current week/previous week:
* Cumulative Collection Operation: 
** The previous week is displaying the same value from the current one (both Created and Resolved issues). In this case the value until the previous week should be lower than it is (you can check that by clicking to see the results in the issue navigator)
 !Screen Shot 2018-11-06 at 14.40.12.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2018-11-06 at 15.13.53.png|thumbnail! 
** The value for the Created issues in the current week is displaying a lower value than it should. In this case when I've checked the issue navigator, there Were actually 409 issues created, not 406:
 !Screen Shot 2018-11-06 at 14.48.14.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2018-11-06 at 15.17.33.png|thumbnail! 
* Count Collection Operation:
** The current week is not even counted:
 !Screen Shot 2018-11-06 at 14.57.18.png|thumbnail! 
** The previous week is displaying a higher value than what it should be. It is actually including the value from the current week (even though the value it summed up with is lower than what it should be for the current week). I was able to identify that by creating issues. That would add to the value from the previous week. You can also check in the issue navigator:
  !Screen Shot 2018-11-06 at 14.59.28.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2018-11-06 at 15.23.03.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2018-11-06 at 15.23.17.png|thumbnail! 
{panel}

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud.


h3. Expected Results

The values for the previous week should not count towards the previous one. The value for the current week should match with the one in the issue navigator.

h3. Actual Results

The values for the previous week is higher than it should (it is probably counting values from the current week). The value for the current week does not match with the one displayed in the issue navigator.

h3. Workaround

No workaround at the moment
fields.summary: Inconsistency in the Created vs. Resolved gadget

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When attempting to configure Jira Cloud to [send mail on behalf of a custom domain|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/configuring-jira-cloud-to-send-emails-on-behalf-of-your-domain-900996548.html], if the subdomain entered into domain-check.atlassian.com starts with a numeral the check will fail and a HTTP 422 (Unprocessable Entity) error will be returned in the browser dev console. In addition, if you attempt to configure a custom project e-mail address in JIRA using a claimed domain that begins with a numeral this will also fail and return an error stating 'DKIM/SPF validation error.' This occurs despite the SPF and DKIM DNS configuration being correct.
h3. Environment

Jira Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to [https://domain-check.atlassian.com|https://domain-check.atlassian.com/]
 # Enter a subdomain that starts with a numeral (ex. messages.2wire.com, mail.99perblems.com)
 # Click 'Check' button

Or attempt to configure a custom project e-mail using a claimed domain that start with a numeral
 # Choose the Jira icon (  !https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/files/946613651/946613716/1/1520474494630/core.png|width=19! ,   !https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/files/946613651/946613719/1/1520474554077/software.png|width=19! ,   !https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/files/946613651/946613718/1/1520474568265/servicedesk.png|width=19! ,   !https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/files/946613651/959785988/1/1538713322379/Jira+Ops-icon-neutral-rgb%402x.png|width=16!  or   !https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/files/946613651/946613717/1/1520474599238/jirafamily.png|width=19! ) > *Projects*.
 # Select *Settings* > *Summary.*
 # Under the *Notifications* section and click the pencil icon to the right of the *Email* address.
 # In the resulting *Project Email Address* dialog box, enter a valid email address in the *Email* field, and click *Update*.

h3. Expected Results

SPF\DKIM records are verified or found to be missing
The project e-mail is set successfully.
h3. Actual Results

'Unknown server error' is displayed.
Checking the browser dev console, a HTTP 422 error is returned.
{code:java}
Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 422 ()
 index.js:83 Error: Request failed with status code 422
 at e.exports (createError.js:15)
 at e.exports (settle.js:18)
 at XMLHttpRequest.d.(/anonymous function) (https://domain-check.atlassian.com/static/js/main.748193d6.js:4:8199)\{code}
{code}
 Attempting to set the project e-mail results in 'DKIM/SPF validation error.'
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: DKIM\SPF Validation Fails for Subdomains That Start With a Numeral

fields.description:
YouTrack has a feature called commands which you can execute on issues without having to deal with menus.

Such feature will make working with issues easier.

For example: when I need to mark a SD issue as resolved I have to perform some predefined steps, like adding a comment, setting a few fields and setting status. With apply command feature I all heave to do is to write some commands like

 
{code:java}
comment "new comment"
set "Last Commit" 12345
set "Doc Url" "http://docs/newfeature"
resolve
{code}
 

 

ref: https://www.jetbrains.com/help/youtrack/standalone/Commands.html

fields.description:
Due to limitations in the Jira text search, it is currently not possible to search for issues that contain comments, summary, or description that might contain patterned text that the customer might need to search for.

For example, there are no ways to search for issues that contain text in a pattern like "####-####-####" where the "#"'s represent a single digit that the user does not know when searching.

Because many instances can have vast numbers of tickets, using the REST API may not be viable, and extracting the relevant text fields may provide a greater strain on the system than providing a method to perform searches like this directly from the cloud.

To that end, I would like to offer the suggestion that we provide the ability to run Regex text searches against individual text fields including description and summary.
fields.summary: provide regex search against text fields.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Pasting an image into comments produces different results across instances and OS, sometimes a pop-up will appear which deletes any comment that is the progress of being typed, other times no pop-up appears and the markup {noformat}!image_name.png|thumbnail!{noformat} is inserted directly into the comments and the image uploaded.

Also when the pop-up does appear it removes any comments that are in the process of being written, usually where the image is intended to be inserted.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue
# Write a comment and copy & paste an image into the comment while writing.

h3. Expected Results
Consistent behaviour that attaches the image and doesn't remove the comment. If pop-up appears the image should be attached and the markup placed in the comment to include the thumbnail.

h3. Actual Results
Behaviour I have observer (all tested using Chrome 70):

*On my instance the following:*
OSX + Mouse  = Pop-up
OSX + Keyboard = Pop-up
Win10 + Mouse = No pop-up
Win10 + Keyboard = No pop-up

*Customers instance: *
OSX + Mouse = Pop-up
OSX + Keyboard = Pop-up
Win10 + Mouse = Pop-up
Win10 + Keyboard = Pop-up

Whenever the pop-up does appear it removes the comment that was in the process of being written and was the intended destination for the image attachment. 
 
h3. Notes
Instance details in internal comment to protect privacy.
I have also attache HAR files of both observed results.

h3. Workaround
Paste the image directly into the issue without selecting inside a comment field as this will create a pop-up where the image can be uploaded and a comment added at the same time.
fields.summary: Inconsistent image attachment behaviour between instances and OS' relating to attachment pop-up and copy/pasting images.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The operation to add users to groups is a case-sensitive operation.  The operation will fail with error {{User <Abc> does not exist}} if the user key in the URL doesn't match the casing.

This may happen to admins who created the user via REST API and accessing the user's account by directly building the URL for memberships configuration.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Go to any user from user management.
# In the URL, change the user key at the end of the URL e.g. from {{.../view?username=abc}} to {{.../view?username=Abc}}.
# Viewing the user's account is still working without any issue.
# Try to add the user to a group.

h3. Expected Result
User is added into the group considering that there's no error in viewing the user's account.

h3. Current Result
{{User <Abc> does not exist}} is thrown.

h3. Workaround
Access the user's account via Atlassian Cloud user management to have the exact casing of the user key in the URL.
fields.summary: Adding users to group failed due to case sensitivity

fields.description:
h2. Summary
Browser extensions like Mobex causes Jira login to fail.

h2. How to reproduce
# In chrome add the extension Mobex
# Log out of Atlassian 
# Try to log back into id.atlassian.com

h3. Expected behavior
Login successful

h3. Actual results
Login unsuccessful
Error message: OOps... you've performed a malformed request.

h2. Workaround
Clear browser cache and disable extensions until you find the cause
fields.summary: Browser extensions (Mobex) cause Jira login to fail

fields.description: Cannot add confluence as app link in Jira using whatever public key consumer key and shared secrect
fields.summary: Cannot add confluence as app link in jira

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Jira doesn't always send email for filter subscription.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a filter with any JQL (see below for example)
 ** project = ABC AND created >= -1h
 # Create a filter subscription to make Jira send email every 15 min (or 1 hour). Make sure *Email this filter, even if there are no issues found* is ticked.
 ** !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Result

Jira doesn't always send email every 15 min.
h3. Expected Result

Jira keep sending the email every 15 min regardless if it returns result or not.

h4. Workaround

Tests show that the 'Advanced' mode using a cron expression is not affected, so use this mode.

As an example, if you want to run your subscription every 15 minutes from Monday to Friday, from 8 AM to 10 PM use this:
{code}
0 0/15 8-10 ? * MON-FRI
{code}
fields.summary: Jira doesn't always send email for filter subscription

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

If you type a comment in the new issue detail view, highlight a part of the text, click on the code block icon (<>), then press ctrl + z right after, the comment will disappear.

If you close the window and get back to the same issue, the comment appears again.

See the recording:  [^Issue detail view comment.mp4] 

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

1) Go to a Kanban Board (or business)
2) Click on an issue
3) Click to add a comment to that issue
4) Type some text
5) Highlight something in the middle of what has been typed so far
6) Click the "<>" button
7) Press CTRL+Z

h3. Expected Results

It should only remake the previous change in the comment.

h3. Actual Results

The whole comment will disappear.

h3. Workaround

No workaround at the moment
fields.summary: Comment will disappear in the new issue detail view if you press ctrl + z after adding the code tag

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Unable to play mp4 in Chrome and Firefox

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# While using Chrome/Firefox, add mp4 file in any Jira issue
# Once mp4 file added, try to preview it

h3. Expected Results
MP4 video will be preview

h3. Actual Results
* Unable to preview the file
 !mp4.jpg|thumbnail! 
* Browser console show the following error
{noformat}
VIDEOJS: ERROR: (CODE:4 MEDIA_ERR_SRC_NOT_SUPPORTED) The video could not be loaded, either because the server or network failed or because the format is not supported. 

Uncaught (in promise) DOMException: Failed to load because no supported source was found.
{noformat}
 
h3. Workaround
* Use Edge or Safari
* Alternatively, you can also download the file and play it using an app form your machine
fields.summary: Unable to preview mp4 attachment in Firefox, Chrome, IE and Edge

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
It would be great to have a notification (email, pop-up) when an issue is nearing due date. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add an event in the notification scheme which can send the notification for required users.

h3. Workaround

* Create a Filter.
* Define and run your search. Below is the sample JQL query to obtain the issues that are past due date.
* {noformat}
project= {Mention the project} and  duedate <= now()
{noformat}
You can edit the JQL to customize it with Issue type, status etc with respect to the requirement.
{noformat}
project = SOF and  issuetype = bug and  status="In Progress" AND duedate <= now()
{noformat}
* Subscribe to the filter
fields.summary: Notification for issues nearing Due date
